result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance Raymond Jacobs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other probation now serving

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Must comply with any other recommendations for treatment or programming deemed appropriate by your probation agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lance Raymond Jacobs

defendant.name: Jacobs, Lance Raymond
defendant.address: W11404 Spring Creek Rd #3, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared in person in custody from the Jackson County Jail with counsel SPD Carly Sebion.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  State filed amended Informations on both 09CF37 & 15CF60.  Defense waives reading of Informations.  State has complied with victim notification.  Judge reviews amended Informations/charges/elements/plea questionnaire & wavier of rights with defendant.  09CF37 - No contest pleas to all 4 counts.  15CF60 - No contest plea to Count 1.  Court finds pleas are made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently and rights waived freely and voluntarily; factual basis exists, finding of guilty.  There is a joint recommendation for probation with conditions.  Court orders 3 years probation concurrent with following conditions:    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact with victims or their property in 09CF37.  Must comply with any other recommendations of probation agent deems appropriate.  Must pay costs with the DNA surcharge ordered on 15CF60 only.  90 days jail as a condition of probation ordered on 15CF60 with credit for 66 days served.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Sebion appeared.  Defendant did not appear.  Plea/sentencing set for 6/8/15 at 1:30 pm

Status conference at 06-01-2015 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 05-13-2015 10:00 am.

Covers case no. 15CF60 and 09CF37.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request. Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Murphy's apartments and victims, Guillermo O. or Keith R.   Must reside with his mother, and abide by her rules.

Reading of information waived.  NGP entered by court.  PTC & STC set.  Attorney Sebion requests that the cash bond be lowered, or a high signature bond.  DA Fox speaks.  Court questioned Attorney Sebion.  Attorney Sebion speaks.  Court reduced the cash bond to $250 with same conditions.  Must reside with his mother and abide by her rules.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, and with Attorney Sebion.  Court reviewed form with the defendant.  Defendant stated that he understood the waiver.  Court found that the defendant waived his preliminary hearing.

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail by video with counsel SPD Carly Sebion present in courtroom.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Sebion requested to also address the new case 15CF60 along with 09CF37; waived reading of complaint and requests preliminary hearing be scheduled within time limits; requesting bond be amended to signature bond and he now lives here with is mother.  Court reviewed charges/possible penalties.  DA argues cash bond should remain in place as 09CF37 has been in warrant status since 2009.  Court reduces cash bond amount with conditions.  Attorney Sebion to schedule preliminary hearing with judicial assistant.

As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

Defendant appeared by video from jackson County Jail.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Signature bond set with conditions.  Defendant is advised to contact public defender for representation.  Probable cause found.  Set for adjourned initial appearance 5-4-15 at 9:30.  Jail staff stated DNA was taken when booked in.
